sub_title: Partner at TIIN Capital | European Cyber Tech Fund V | Forbes 30 Under 30
summary: Multilingual professional with 8+ years’ experience in venture capital, startup business development, fundraising and deep tech. Passionate about commercializing technology to (i) benefit society and (ii) create jobs. Forbes 30 under 30. Venture Capital Journal’s 40 Rising Stars under 40.

school.name: Quantic School of Business and Technology

education.degree_name: Certificate, Spanish Language & Culture at Advanced Level (cum laude)

awards.title: Honoree on Venture Capital Journal's 40 Rising Stars Under 40
awards.description:
In 2021, I was included in Venture Capital Journal's annual ranking of 40 Rising Stars Under 40. I am the first Dutch citizen who made it to this list. 

https://www.venturecapitaljournal.com/rising-stars-2021

awards.title: Winner of the Healthcare & Pharmaceutical Awards 2020 - Category: Best Medical Device Coatings Company (Team Achievement)

LipoCoat has been awarded the Healthcare & Pharmaceutical Award for Best Medical Device Coatings Company of 2020.

https://www.ghp-news.com/winners/lipocoat/

awards.title: Nominee for the VIVA400 Awards 2020 - Category: Tech & Innovation
awards.description:
Dutch magazine Viva nominated me for the VIVA400 Awards, an annual award to honor extraordinary women from the Netherlands. I was nominated in the Tech & Innovation category.

https://www.viva.nl/viva400/tech-innovatie/

https://biotech-europe.startupcity.com/vendors/most-promising-biotech-startups-in-europe.html

awards.title: Most Consistent Top Performing Venture Capital Fund Manager of 2020 (Team Achievement)
awards.description:
The investment team of Cottonwood Technology Fund is featured as one of the 'Most Consistent Top Performing Venture Capital Fund Managers of 2020' in the Preqin Global Private Equity & Venture Capital Report 2020. 

The report can be purchased here: https://www.preqin.com/insights/global-alternatives-reports/2020-preqin-global-private-equity-venture-capital-report/26652

awards.title: Finalist for Best Young Professional of the Netherlands 2019
awards.description:
Out of 1,000 applications, I was chosen as one of 10 finalists for Best Young Professional of the Netherlands 2019. As a finalist, I won an online MBA training course ('SpeedMBA Online').

The Top 100 of Best Young Professionals of the Netherlands 2019 can be found here: https://bestyoungprofessionals.nl/best-young-professionals-2019.html

awards.title: Nominee for Dutch Tech Girl of the Month
awards.description:
TechGirl Nederland is Holland's largest tech & gadget website for women. In November 2019, I was nominated for Dutch Tech Girl of the Month. 

You can read my interview with TechGirl Nederland here: https://www.techgirl.nl/marie-weijler-je-hoeft-geen-ingenieur-te-zijn-om-je-dingen-eigen-te-maken/

awards.title: Shortlisted Nominee for the EWPN Awards 2019 - Category: Emerging Fintech Leader of the Year
awards.description:
In 2019, I was shortlisted for the Emerging Fintech Leader Award, which is awarded to one rising star and aspiring leader in fintech (aged 18-35) who is making a mark in the industry. I made it to the final four.

https://ewpnamsterdam2019.eu/awards/

awards.title: Honoree on the Forbes 30 Under 30: Europe 2019 - Category: Finance
awards.description:
In 2019, I was included in the annual Forbes 30 Under 30: Europe list in the Finance category. I am the first Dutch citizen who made it to the list in this category. 

https://www.forbes.com/profile/marie-weijler/

Dutch magazine Viva nominated me for the VIVA400 Awards, an annual award to honor extraordinary women from the Netherlands. I was nominated in the 'Zakenwonder' category (loose translation: Rising Star in Business). 

https://www.viva.nl/viva400/zakenwonders/

company.name: TIIN Capital | Dutch Security Tech Fund

profile_positions.company: TIIN Capital | Dutch Security Tech Fund
profile_positions.description:
TIIN Capital was founded in 1998. We're currently raising for European Cyber Tech Fund V, which will invest in cybersecurity and IoT security startups and scale-ups based in Europe.

If you would like to learn more about TIIN Capital and our new fund, please contact me at weijler(at)tiincapital.nl  

Main Responsibilities:
• Fund Management
• Investor Relations & Fundraising
• Portfolio Management

Key Accomplishments:
• Managed the website redesign
• Doubled the number of TIIN Capital's LinkedIn followers in 11 months
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.description:
• Assessing high-tech and life science startups that applied for a €250.000 loan (twice per year).
• More information on the funding program: https://www.nwo.nl/en/researchprogrammes/take
profile_positions.title: Member of the Startup Funding Committee

profile_positions.description:
I regularly sit on panels at investor conferences and startup events to share my knowledge and experience.

Past:
• Women Disrupting Tech Podcast, 10/02/2023 (Topic: 'Entrepreneurship')
• Startup Festival of the Northern Netherlands 2022 (Topic: 'Marketing Strategies for Startups')
• Upstream Festival 2022 (Topic: 'Investing in Deeptech')
• Facing Challenges Summit 2022 (Topic: 'Science Equity Best Practices')
• Pitch Jury Member at Innovation for Health Conference 2022
• TOPX Network Summit 2021 (Topic: 'Entrepreneurship & Funding')
• Guest Lecturer at University of Twente, Fall 2021 (Topic: 'International Tech Entrepreneurship')
• Present Your Startup 2021 (Topic: 'Introduction to Venture Capital')
• Women in AI Summit 2020 (Topic: 'Can VCs Be Champions Of Impact Investments?')
• Commit2Data Master Class on Valorization 2020 (Topic: 'Networking & Finding Customers')
• European Women in Technology Conference 2019 (Topic: Is Your Startup Ready For An Investor?)
• Women of Silicon Roundabout Conference 2019 (Topic: ‘Is Your Startup Ready For An Investor?’)
• EuroGrowth 2019 (Topics: ‘Family Offices: A New Competitor For Direct Deals' and ‘Strengthening Relationships To Attract LPs') 
• Female Impact Dinner 2019 (Topic: 'Practical Career Advice for Women')
• DACH Private Equity Conference 2019 (Topic: 'Early Stage Investments: VC & Growth')
• Dutch Talk Show 'Na Het Nieuws', 27/03/2019 (Topic: 'Female Talent In The Financial Industry')
• Benelux Private Equity Conference 2019 (Topic: 'Early Stage Investments: VC & Growth')
• SuperVenture 2019 (Topic: 'Impact Investing: How Not To Sacrifice Returns')
• Women in Private Equity Forum 2018 (Topic: 'Developing A Successful Fundraising Strategy')
• Amsterdam Capital Week 2018 (Topic: 'How Do Corporates Compete Against Traditional Investors In The Trending Technology Landscape?')
• Benelux Private Equity Conference 2018 (Topic: 'LPs Only: Direct & Co-Investing')
profile_positions.title: Panelist & Guest Speaker

profile_positions.description:
LipoCoat is a nanotech startup that enables sustainable infection control and prevents antibiotic resistance. Applications of its award-winning coating technology include catheters, contact lenses and implants.  

Main Responsibilities:
• Legal & Compliance
• Investor Relations & Fundraising
• Marketing & PR

Key Accomplishments:
• Helped raise €1.5 million extra during the COVID-19 crisis.
• Introduced LipoCoat to 12 corporates.
• Pitched LipoCoat at the Benelux finals of the Extreme Tech Challenge 2022 (world’s largest startup competition) and won a ticket for the global finals.
• Registered LipoCoat for the Heraeus Accelerator Contest and won out of 1,000 applicants, resulting in a partnership with Heraeus Medivio for coated medical devices.
• Successfully applied for the 'IPA4SME subsidy', granted by the European Commission.
• Successfully applied for the 'SIB Voucher Marktentree' subsidy, granted by the Dutch government.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Cottonwood Technology Fund is a top-decile venture capital fund specialized in early stage B2B deep tech.

Main Tasks:
• Portfolio Management
• Board Observer at SmartNanotubes Technologies
• Investor Relations & Fundraising
• Deal Sourcing
• Legal, Compliance & ESG

Key Accomplishments:
• Co-responsible for raising Fund III (total fund size: $85 million).
• $1.3 billion exit of portfolio company Sarcos Robotics (team achievement).
• Supported 9 portfolio companies with follow-on funding, sales and marketing.
• Expanded Cottonwood’s network of potential co-investors with 77 corporates.
• Developed Cottonwood's ESG Policy, Conflict of Interest Policy, and Diversity & Inclusion Policy.
• Honoree on Venture Capital Journal's 40 Rising Stars Under 40 2021.
• Nominee for the M&A Awards 2020 - Category: Best Young Private Equity Manager.
profile_positions.title: Investment Manager

profile_positions.description:
Princip.al is a fintech startup that offers a deal sourcing platform to private investors. I was the first employee. In < 2 years, I expanded the client base from 450 to 1,500+ single family offices, HNWIs and private equity firms. 

Main Responsibilities:
• Deal Sourcing & Analysis
• Investor Relations & Fundraising
• Strategic Partnerships

Key Accomplishments:
• Promoted to Senior Manager after establishing partnerships with 15 large corporates, incl. McKinsey, BlackRock, PwC, UBS, Stibbe, Deutsche Bank & ABN AMRO. 
• Generated 49% of total company revenue in 2018 and surpassed my personal target by 24%. 
• Involved in raising €25 million for UnifiedPost (€252 million IPO in 2020).
• Raised funds for 747 Capital, Capricorn Venture Partners and Kharis Capital.
• Honoree on the Forbes 30 Under 30 Europe 2019 - Category: Finance
• Nominee for the EWPN Awards 2019 - Category: Emerging Fintech Leader of the Year
• Nominee for the VIVA400 Awards 2018 - Category: ''Zakenwonder'' (Rising Star in Business)
profile_positions.title: Senior Business Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Key Accomplishments:
• Promoted within 10 months to management position.
• Expanded the client base from 450 to 1,500+ single family offices and private equity firms.
• Sourced 106 investment projects in high-tech industries and real estate (2016-2019).
• Initiated and headed the business expansion into the Netherlands. Under my leadership, the business activities in the Netherlands became the most profitable for the company. 
• Trained and supervised 15 interns of 13 nationalities.
• Organized 37 investor events in 2 countries (2016-2019).
profile_positions.title: Junior Business Development Manager

volunteer_experiences.description:
Founded by a team of McKinsey, Google, Spotify, MIT and Harvard alumni, Antler VC has grown into an early stage venture capital firm with startup accelerator programs on 4 continents. 

More information: https://antler.co

Collider is a startup accelerator program for tech startups in e-commerce, marketing, advertising and media. 

In 2020, I was one of 10 young professionals selected as 'NextGen' angel investor. We complement the existing investor network by bringing a different perspective to the table – one that comes from digital natives with relevant work experience to take the startups to the next level.

More information: https://www.collider.io/

The Young Twente Board collaborates with the government, research institutions and entrepreneurs in Twente to strengthen the local economy. Objectives include more investments in sustainable technologies and job creation. 

More information: https://www.twente.com/young-twente-board

The Association for Corporate Growth (ACG) is a global community of 14,500 investors, M&A professionals and related service providers. There are 57 chapters in North America and Europe. These chapters meet regularly, organize events and provide a forum to network, share best practices and source deals.

More information: https://www.acg.org/holland

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the CES® Selection Committee (Dutch Delegation)
volunteer_experiences.description:
CES® is the most influential tech event in the world – the proving ground for breakthrough technologies and global innovators. This is where the world's biggest brands do business and meet new partners, and the sharpest innovators hit the stage.

As a member of the CES® selection committee, I assessed tech startups that wanted to join the Dutch delegation at CES in 2021 and 2022, and participated in follow-up events. 

More information: https://www.ces.tech/

The Arcadis City of 2030 Accelerator (powered by Techstars) was an accelerator program for tech startups which improve the quality of life in one of the following areas: 1) Water & Waste Management 2) Climate & Safety 3) Mobility 4) Proptech. 

More information: https://www.techstars.com/accelerators/arcadis-urban

ReStartup was a free-of-charge 4-month support program for startups to manage and recover from the COVID-19 crisis. I participated in this program as a volunteer mentor.

More information: https://dutchstartupassociation.nl/

volunteer_experiences.role: Founder & President of the Dutch Chapter
volunteer_experiences.description:
Global Zero is the international movement for a world without nuclear weapons. It is supported by 300+ world leaders, including Carl Bildt, Mary Robinson, Javier Solana, Hans van den Broek, Ivo H. Daalder, Vicente Fox, Muhammad Yunus and HM Queen Noor of Jordan.

Overview:
• Awarded full scholarship to attend seminars at Yale University, New Haven (CT).
• Trained 100+ volunteers at summits in Chicago and Brussels. The latter was attended by HM Queen Noor of Jordan.
• Doubled the number of active volunteers in the Netherlands within one year.
• While studying in Paris, volunteered for the French chapter.

More information: https://www.globalzero.org/

Weekly support for people with a chronic lung disease.

More information: https://www.longfonds.nl/
